repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
[feat(vim-patch.sh): -M lists all ported patches](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/36585/commits/3af3261692b8e6fa19e54ea5455c6f597e1bab2d)

Start from current "v:version".
Exclude reverted patches.
Track reverted patches in vimpatch_token_reverts.txt because no convention in git-log.

<!--
  Thank you for contributing to Neovim!
  If this is your first time, check out https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests-prs
  for our PR guidelines.
-->

comment_data.body: I committed the version.c update from https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/36365 to visualize the update from vimpatch.lua.

Due to the partial reverts.
But, was the intended fix ported though or was it N/A in the end?

Need new data structure for included_patches, diverging from Vim.

- struct with major_minor_version and `int[]`
- `int[][]`
- ???
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -15,31 +15,45 @@ local function systemlist(...)
   return rv
 end
 
-local function vimpatch_sh_list_numbers()
+local function vimpatch_sh_list_tokens()
   return systemlist({ { 'bash', '-c', 'scripts/vim-patch.sh -M' } })
 end
 
--- Generates the lines to be inserted into the src/version.c
+-- Generates the lines to be inserted into the src/nvim/version.c
 -- `included_patches[]` definition.
 local function gen_version_c_lines()
-  -- Set of merged Vim 8.1.zzzz patch numbers.
-  local merged_patch_numbers = {}
-  local highest = 0
-  for _, n in ipairs(vimpatch_sh_list_numbers()) do
-    n = tonumber(n)
-    if n then
-      merged_patch_numbers[n] = true
-      highest = math.max(highest, n)
+  -- Sets of merged Vim x.y.zzzz patch numbers.
+  local merged_patch_sets = {}
+  for _, token in ipairs(vimpatch_sh_list_tokens()) do
+    local major_version, minor_version, patch_num = string.match(token, '^(%d+).(%d+).(%d+)$')
+    local n = tonumber(patch_num)
+    -- TODO(@janlazo): Allow multiple Vim versions
+    -- if n then
+    if n and major_version == '8' and minor_version == '1' then
+      local major_minor_version = major_version * 100 + minor_version
+      merged_patch_sets[major_minor_version] = merged_patch_sets[major_minor_version] or {}
+      table.insert(merged_patch_sets[major_minor_version], n)
     end
   end
 
+  local sorted_versions = {}
+  for k, _ in pairs(merged_patch_sets) do
+    table.insert(sorted_versions, k)
+  end
+  table.sort(sorted_versions)
   local lines = {}
-  for i = highest, 0, -1 do
-    local is_merged = (nil ~= merged_patch_numbers[i])
-    if is_merged then
-      table.insert(lines, string.format('  %s,', i))
-    else
-      table.insert(lines, string.format('  // %s,', i))
+  for _, major_minor_version in ipairs(sorted_versions) do
+    -- table.insert(lines, string.format('  // major minor version: %s', major_minor_version))

comment_data.body:
Not experiencing perf hit running sed earlier than `| sort | uniq`.
Can afford to left-zero-pad now so that reverts.txt will contain the padded vimpatch token.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -573,10 +573,16 @@ list_vimpatch_tokens() {
 # Prints all patch-numbers (for the current v:version) for which there is
 # a "vim-patch:xxx" token in the Nvim git log.
 list_vimpatch_numbers() {
-  # Transform "vim-patch:X.Y.ZZZZ" to "ZZZZ".
-  list_vimpatch_tokens | while read -r vimpatch_token; do
-    echo "$vimpatch_token" | grep -F '8.1.' | sed -Ee 's/.*vim-patch:8\.1\.([0-9a-z]+).*/\1/'
-  done
+  local patch_pat='(8\.[12]|9\.[0-9])\.[0-9]{1,4}'
+  diff "${NVIM_SOURCE_DIR}/scripts/vimpatch_token_reverts.txt" <(
+    git -C "${NVIM_SOURCE_DIR}" log --format="%s%n%b" -E --grep="^[* ]*vim-patch:${patch_pat}" |
+    grep -oE "^[* ]*vim-patch:${patch_pat}" |
+    sed -nEe 's/^[* ]*vim-patch:('"${patch_pat}"').*$/\1/p' |

comment_data.body:
I have 3 arrays but they can be merged into 1 struct array instead. 

- supported vim versions (major * 100 + minor)
- merged patch "sets"  (can't use `ARRAY_SIZE()` macro)
    - number of merged patches for each supported vim version 

Get index from vim_versions array to access the other arrays.
`vim_versions[0]` defaults to current `v:version`  so `version.h` macros were modified/removed.

-----

Tracking reverted patches in a blacklist is file is trivial. `vim-patch.sh -M` uses it.
vimpatch.lua is indifferent to patch reverts.
I posted https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/36585#discussion_r2540783336 because I'm not experiencing performance issues. 

-----

I want to diverge from Vim's `included_patches[]` by reducing the line count for all merged patches.
7000+ / 12189 lines just for patch numbers is ... too much.
Maybe `vimpatch.lua` should go to `src/` for "code generation".

comment_data.body:
> 7000+ / 12189 lines just for patch numbers is ... too much.

Agreed. For versions older than `v:version` (i.e. versions that we "graduated" from), we only need the inverse list (i.e. the list of patches we *don't* have), which should be much smaller.

comment_data.body: TODO: vimpatch.lua automation.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -15,16 +15,7 @@ extern char *version_cflags;
 // Vim version number, name, etc. Patchlevel is defined in version.c.
 //
 
-// Values that change for a new release
-#define VIM_VERSION_MAJOR                8
-#define VIM_VERSION_MINOR                1
-
-// Values based on the above
-#define VIM_VERSION_MAJOR_STR STR(VIM_VERSION_MAJOR)
-#define VIM_VERSION_MINOR_STR STR(VIM_VERSION_MINOR)
-#define VIM_VERSION_100     (VIM_VERSION_MAJOR * 100 + VIM_VERSION_MINOR)
-
 // swap file compatibility (max. length is 6 chars)
-#define VIM_VERSION_SHORT VIM_VERSION_MAJOR_STR "." VIM_VERSION_MINOR_STR
+#define VIM_VERSION_SHORT "8.1"

comment_data.body:
I didn't imply versions older than `8.1` but we can do that in another PR. I intentionally filtered out the older Vim versions to maintain the current behavior.

Tracking all merged patches since the beginning of the fork will need another refactor since I depend on a sorted `vim-patch:` token list to automate the minimum version.

Was expecting these lines to be modified after `make formatc`.
Were comments excluded for hard wrap?

-  -- Set of merged Vim 8.1.zzzz patch numbers.
-  local merged_patch_numbers = {}
-  local highest = 0
-  for _, n in ipairs(vimpatch_sh_list_numbers()) do
-    n = tonumber(n)
-    if n then
-      merged_patch_numbers[n] = true
-      highest = math.max(highest, n)
+  -- Sets of merged Vim x.y.zzzz patch numbers.
+  local merged_patch_sets = {}
+  for _, token in ipairs(vimpatch_sh_list_tokens()) do
+    local major_version, minor_version, patch_num = string.match(token, '^(%d+).(%d+).(%d+)$')
+    local n = tonumber(patch_num)
+    -- TODO(@janlazo): Allow multiple Vim versions
+    -- if n then
+    if n and major_version == '8' and minor_version == '1' then
+      local major_minor_version = major_version * 100 + minor_version
+      merged_patch_sets[major_minor_version] = merged_patch_sets[major_minor_version] or {}
+      table.insert(merged_patch_sets[major_minor_version], n)
     end
   end
 
+  local sorted_versions = {}
+  for k, _ in pairs(merged_patch_sets) do
+    table.insert(sorted_versions, k)
+  end
+  table.sort(sorted_versions)
   local lines = {}
-  for i = highest, 0, -1 do
-    local is_merged = (nil ~= merged_patch_numbers[i])
-    if is_merged then
-      table.insert(lines, string.format('  %s,', i))
-    else
-      table.insert(lines, string.format('  // %s,', i))
+  for _, major_minor_version in ipairs(sorted_versions) do
+    -- table.insert(lines, string.format('  // major minor version: %s', major_minor_version))

comment_data.body: Can this or `has_vim_patch()` be simplified?

comment_regular_data.body:
I'll rebase-squash after review.
Should add new (unit?) tests but should they be automated too (based on `vim-patch.sh -M`)? We can hardcode some of the merged patches unlikely to be reverted.

Anything blocking the merge or another review? Added the missing docs and tests.

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/36585#discussion_r2540771853 is left open to consider a struct to reconsider `ARRAY_SIZE()`.
Would like to cut down on at least 1 of the new arrays but the tradeoff could be new  `int <==> str` converters.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability.
repo.name: neovim

title: feat(version): support multiple Vim versions
